title: Function Overloading - Multiple Functions, Same Name
description: Learn how to define multiple functions with the same name but different parameters

content.introduction:
Sometimes you want to perform the same conceptual operation on different types of data. **Function overloading** lets you define multiple functions with the same name, as long as they have different parameter lists!

The compiler automatically chooses the right version based on the arguments you pass.

### What You'll Learn
- What function overloading is
- How the compiler resolves overloaded functions
- Rules for overloading (different parameters required)
- Practical uses of overloading
- Overloading vs default parameters

concepts.title: Overload Resolution
concepts.description: The compiler chooses which function to call based on the number and types of arguments provided

concepts.title: Signature Difference
concepts.description: Overloaded functions must differ in parameter count or parameter types. Return type alone is not enough!

concepts.title: Code Clarity
concepts.description: Overloading makes code more intuitive - you can use the same function name for related operations on different types

concepts.title: Reintroduce Keyword
concepts.description: In DWScript, use 'reintroduce' keyword when overloading to explicitly declare multiple versions

examples.title: Basic Overloading
examples.description: Two functions with the same name but different parameter types

examples.title: Different Parameter Counts
examples.description: Overload based on the number of parameters

examples.title: Print Function Overloading
examples.description: Create a flexible Print function that works with different types
examples.expectedOutput:

examples.title: Distance Calculation
examples.description: Calculate distance with different sets of coordinates
examples.expectedOutput:
Distance from origin to (3,4): 5
Distance between (1,2) and (4,6): 5

examples.title: Format String Overloading
examples.description: Different formatting options for the same operation

exercises.title: Overloaded Multiply
exercises.description: Create an overloaded `Multiply` function that works with: (1) two integers, (2) three integers, (3) two floats.
hints: Use the 'overload' keyword after each function declaration
First version: two Integer parameters, returns Integer
Second version: three Integer parameters, returns Integer
Third version: two Float parameters, returns Float

exercises.title: Area Calculator
exercises.description: Create overloaded `Area` functions for: (1) square (one side), (2) rectangle (width, height), (3) circle (radius). Use π ≈ 3.14159.
hints: For circle, you might need a different name (AreaCircle) to avoid ambiguity with square

exercises.title: Greeting Generator
exercises.description: Create overloaded `Greet` procedures: (1) takes name only, (2) takes name and title (Mr., Ms., etc.), (3) takes name, title, and greeting word.
hints: All three are procedures (no return value)
Third: name, title, and greeting parameters
Use string concatenation to build the greeting

content.summary:
Excellent work mastering function overloading!

- **Overloading**: Multiple functions with the same name but different parameters
- Use the `overload` keyword in DWScript
- Functions must differ in parameter count or types
- The compiler automatically chooses the right version
- Overloading improves code readability and usability
- Common in math functions, formatting, and conversions

Function overloading is a powerful feature that makes your code more flexible and intuitive to use!
